intro: Arthratherum subacaule, commonly known as the slender jointed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Arthratherum subacaule typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows, roadsides, and woodland edges. Its ecological role includes providing food for various insects and serving as a pioneer species in ecological succession.
